13/4/2024 updated on 15/4/2024, 21/5/202: Government Gazettes of 6th July 1978 and 18th August 1978,Penyata Pilihanraya Umum Dewan Rakyat dan Dewan-Dewan Undangan Negeri kecuali Dewan-Dewan Undangan Negeri Kelantan, Sabah dan Sarawak 1978, New Straits Times 7th April 1982, The politics of accommodation: An analysis of the 1978 Malaysian general election (Research notes and discussions papers - Institute of Southeast Asian Studies ; no. 10) Paperback – January 1, 1978 by Ismail Kassim. Calon-Calon Wanita yang Bertanding dalam Pilihanraya Umum 1955 - 1986. For specific Parliamentarian Candidate background details, refer to 1978_Other_Sources_Parliament_File

Candidate Names follow the Government Gazette of 6th July 1978 names and there are different spellings and names found on Government Gazette of 17th August 1978. Government Gazette of 17th August 1978 and 1978 EC Report had some errorneous values for Parliamentary Constituency of Ulu Nerus, Telok Anson, Kuantan and Tawau. Gazette values for BN Candidates of Bukit Bendera and Jelutong were corrected. BN Candidate for Parliamentary Constituency of Sungai Besi was disqualified. For Parliamentary Constituency of Kinabatangan, BN allowed Berjaya backed and USNO backed candidates to vye for the seat. Berjaya backed independent won Kinabatangan. MCA candidate status of Parliamentary Constituency of Bandar Kuala Lumpur is made through educated guess through Harold Crouch's publication entitled "Malaysia's 1982 General Election". Independent Candidate of Bukit Mertajam (Tan Cheng Bee) and Tanjong (Hoo Kee Ping) Parliamentary Constituencies are rebel MCA candidates. According to Ismail Kassim, the Independent Candidate for Gaya Parliamentary Constituency (Chin Nyuk Fatt) is part of Sabah Chinese United Party (SCUP). Independent Candidate of Parit Buntar Parliamentary Constituency is dissident Berjasa candidate. Independent Candidate for Bandar Kuching Parliamentary Constituency (Leong Ho Yuen) withdraw from contest after nomination. There is an unknown minor error for Sarawak's rejected vote count. 1978 Election Report errorneously put a total electorate of Negeri Sembilan as 221785. EC made a mistake of total valid votes for seat of Pontian (claiming it is 33146). EC has a contradictory Rejected Vote values for 190 and 193 for seat of Tawau. EC has an errorneous total ballots issued for Padawan (claiming it is 15968). EC has contradictory information on who lost deposits. TindakMalaysia Network Services PLT is not responsible for any errors or ommissions arising from the original data or its derivatives
